title: Arigato Shoes: The Ultimate Guide to Axel Arigato's Premium Swedish Sneakers
description: Discover everything you need to know about arigato shoes from the premium Swedish brand Axel Arigato. From their flagship Clean 90 model to sizing guides and quality reviews, this comprehensive guide covers why these minimalist sneakers have become a favorite among fashion enthusiasts worldwide. Whether you're exploring national parks or city streets, find the perfect pair for your adventures at Explore National Parks Store.

body:
Arigato Shoes: The Ultimate Guide to Axel Arigato's Premium Swedish Sneakers

Discover everything you need to know about arigato shoes from the premium Swedish brand Axel Arigato. From their flagship Clean 90 model to sizing guides and quality reviews, this comprehensive guide covers why these minimalist sneakers have become a favorite among fashion enthusiasts worldwide. Whether you're exploring national parks or city streets, find the perfect pair for your adventures at Explore National Parks Store.

Table of Contents

  • What Are Arigato Shoes? Understanding the Axel Arigato Brand
  • The Clean 90: Axel Arigato's Flagship Sneaker Model
  • Quality and Materials: Why Arigato Shoes Stand Out
  • Sizing and Fit Guide for Axel Arigato Shoes
  • My Experience Testing Axel Arigato Sneakers
  • Comparing Arigato Shoes to Competitors
  • Conclusion: Are Arigato Shoes Worth the Investment?

What Are Arigato Shoes? Understanding the Axel Arigato Brand

Arigato shoes refer to the premium sneaker collection from Swedish brand Axel Arigato, founded in 2014 by Albin Johansson and Max Svärdh in Gothenburg. The brand name combines "Axel," referencing a mythical figure, with "Arigato," meaning "thank you" in Japanese, reflecting the brand's unique blend of Scandinavian minimalism and Japanese streetwear influences. This cultural fusion has made arigato shoes a distinctive choice for fashion-conscious consumers worldwide.

What sets arigato shoes apart is their direct-to-consumer approach and innovative weekly drop system, departing from traditional seasonal releases. This strategy allows the brand to respond quickly to customer feedback and stay ahead of fashion trends. The company's commitment to sustainability is evident in their use of LWG-certified leather and recycled materials, making these sneakers not just stylish but environmentally conscious.

Axel Arigato has expanded from an online-only brand to having 18 physical retail locations across Europe, with over 242 global stockists. Their stores often host cultural events, album signings, and magazine launches, positioning arigato shoes as more than just footwear—they're part of a lifestyle brand that celebrates the intersection of design, music, and art. Celebrity endorsements from stars like Emily Blunt, Margot Robbie, and Chris Evans have further elevated the brand's status in luxury streetwear.

Shop Axel Arigato Clean 90 on Amazon

The Clean 90: Axel Arigato's Flagship Sneaker Model

The Clean 90 represents the pinnacle of arigato shoes design philosophy, launched in 2016 as Axel Arigato's signature sneaker. This minimalist masterpiece embodies the brand's "clean and uncomplicated" approach, featuring a sleek low-top silhouette that has remained virtually unchanged since its debut. The name "Clean 90" reflects both the shoe's pristine aesthetic and its nod to 1990s sneaker culture, making it a timeless addition to any wardrobe.

What makes the Clean 90 special among arigato shoes is its versatility and attention to detail. The sneaker features subtle branding with a gold "Arigato" stamp on the lateral side, blind eyelets for a streamlined look, and clean stitching throughout. Unlike ultra-narrow Italian competitors, the Clean 90 maintains slightly more volume, giving it a contemporary streetwear edge while remaining sophisticated enough for elevated casual wear. This balance makes it perfect for everything from outdoor adventures to urban exploration.

The Clean 90 collection offers numerous variations, from the classic white leather version to suede options in neutral tones like taupe and black. Special editions include the Clean 90 Bird featuring the brand's iconic bee bird emblem, and the Clean 90 Triple with contrasting heel tabs. Each variation maintains the core DNA of arigato shoes while offering unique style expressions. The pricing typically ranges from $285 to $320, positioning these sneakers in the premium category alongside brands like Off-White shoes and other luxury streetwear.

Clean 90 Key Features:

  • LWG-certified Italian leather construction
  • Handmade in Porto, Portugal
  • 20% recycled rubber sole
  • Cushioned footbed with arch support
  • Available in full and half sizes

Quality and Materials: Why Arigato Shoes Stand Out

The exceptional quality of arigato shoes stems from their commitment to premium materials and sustainable manufacturing practices. Axel Arigato uses LWG (Leather Working Group) certified leather and suede, which ensures environmentally responsible tanning processes while maintaining the highest standards of durability and feel. The brand's leather feels almost buttery to the touch—thick but not stiff, indicating proper treatment for longevity without compromising comfort.

Construction-wise, arigato shoes employ a sophisticated stitched-and-glued cupsole method, preventing the common issue of sole separation found in cheaper sneakers. This technique, combined with handcrafted assembly at family-owned factories in Porto, Portugal, ensures each pair meets exacting quality standards. The attention to detail extends to the leather lining made from 63% leather, 29% recycled polyester, and 8% microfiber, providing excellent breathability and moisture control—crucial features for active wear and long hiking sessions through outdoor terrain.

Sustainability is a cornerstone of arigato shoes production, with the brand incorporating recycled materials wherever possible. The outsole contains at least 20% recycled rubber from the SEAQUAL INITIATIVE, while maintaining excellent flexibility and grip. This eco-conscious approach doesn't compromise performance—the rubber sole provides superior traction for various surfaces, from city pavements to light trail walking. Compared to other premium brands like Amiri shoes, arigato shoes offer similar luxury at a more accessible price point while exceeding sustainability standards.

Premium Shoe Care Kit Sneaker Cleaning Solution

Sizing and Fit Guide for Axel Arigato Shoes

Getting the right fit is crucial when investing in arigato shoes, as proper sizing affects both comfort and longevity. Based on extensive testing and customer feedback, Axel Arigato generally runs true to size, but there are important nuances to consider. The brand offers limited half sizes in US sizing, mapped to EU measurements, which can be particularly helpful for achieving the perfect fit. If you're between sizes, sizing up is typically recommended, especially if you plan to wear thicker socks during outdoor activities.

The fit character of arigato shoes provides a glove-like feel once broken in, with the leather upper conforming to your foot shape over the first few wears. The heel cup is well-structured and secure without being restrictive, while the toe box offers adequate room for natural foot movement—important features whether you're exploring comfortable walking shoes alternatives or seeking premium casual footwear. Unfortunately, wide (EE or EEE) sizes are not available, so those with wider feet should consider sizing up a half size.

Sizing Tips for Arigato Shoes:

  • • Order your normal US size for standard fit
  • • Size up 0.5 if between sizes or prefer roomier fit
  • • Consider sizing up for wide feet (no wide sizes available)
  • • Leather will stretch and soften with wear
  • • Some models like Marathon may run slightly smaller

One minor consideration with arigato shoes is the non-gusseted tongue, which can shift during extended wear. This isn't uncommon in minimalist sneakers and doesn't significantly impact comfort, but it's worth noting for those who prioritize absolute precision in fit. The cushioned insole provides good arch support and can be removed if you prefer custom orthotics, making these sneakers suitable for all-day wear whether you're walking city streets or exploring outdoor paths.

Best For:

  • • Standard to slightly narrow feet
  • • Those who prefer minimalist styling
  • • All-day casual wear
  • • Light outdoor activities

Consider Alternatives If:

  • • You have very wide feet
  • • Need extensive arch support
  • • Prefer ultra-cushioned soles
  • • Require waterproof materials

My Experience Testing Axel Arigato Sneakers

Having worn arigato shoes for over six months in various conditions, I can provide firsthand insights into their real-world performance. My first pair was the Clean 90 in white leather, chosen after comparing them to other premium minimalist options. The initial impression was immediately positive—the packaging alone conveys premium quality with the brand's signature yellow box and protective dust bag, setting expectations high from the unboxing experience.

Breaking in my arigato shoes was surprisingly smooth compared to other leather sneakers I've owned. The first week saw the leather soften significantly, conforming to my foot shape without the typical discomfort associated with high-quality leather footwear. I tested them extensively during a two-week trip to Portland, walking an average of 8-10 miles daily through urban environments, parks, and light hiking trails. The grip proved excellent on wet pavements, while the cushioned insole provided adequate support for extended walking sessions—crucial when exploring destinations similar to sustainable footwear options for outdoor adventures.

Personal Testing Results:

Comfort Rating: 8.5/10

Excellent for daily wear, minimal break-in period

Durability Rating: 9/10

No visible wear after 6 months of regular use

Style Versatility: 9.5/10

Works with casual to smart-casual outfits

Value Rating: 8/10

Premium quality justifies the price point

The most impressive aspect of my arigato shoes experience has been their versatility. I've worn them with everything from jeans and t-shirts to chinos and button-downs, and they consistently elevated my outfits without overwhelming them. The minimalist design philosophy really shines through—these sneakers enhance rather than dominate your style. After six months, they show minimal wear, with only slight creasing in the toe area typical of quality leather. The white colorway has proven remarkably easy to maintain with basic cleaning, though I'd recommend treating suede versions with protective spray for longevity, similar to caring for casual everyday footwear.

Professional Shoe Cleaning Foam

What Users Are Saying About Arigato Shoes

Reddit User

"I have some Arigatos and have to say they are high quality leather. It's like slipping your foot into butter... they're comfortable after breaking them in."

✓ Verified Purchase

Amazon Review

"The leather feels luxurious and the build quality is exceptional. Comfortable right out of the box with extra height from the chunky sole and ample cushioning."

✓ Verified Purchase

Reddit User

"Mixed experience - love the design and quality feels premium, but they don't breathe well and can be stiff initially. Make sure to size up half a size since they run small."

✓ Verified Purchase

User-Reported Pros

  • Premium leather quality
  • Excellent craftsmanship
  • Versatile styling
  • Comfortable after break-in
  • Good durability
  • Sustainable materials

User-Reported Cons

  • Can run small, size up recommended
  • Limited breathability
  • Higher price point
  • Tongue can shift during wear
  • No wide width options
  • Initial stiffness

Comparing Arigato Shoes to Competitors

When evaluating arigato shoes against the competition, several key brands emerge as direct alternatives: Common Projects, Koio, Oliver Cabell, and Thursday Boot Company. Each offers minimalist leather sneakers, but there are significant differences in pricing, construction, and design philosophy. Arigato shoes typically fall in the middle price range at $285-$320, offering better value than Common Projects ($400+) while providing more premium materials than budget options like casual canvas alternatives.

Brand Price Range Origin Key Features
Axel Arigato $285-$320 Portugal LWG leather, 20% recycled sole, half sizes
Common Projects $400-$500 Italy Nappa leather, Margom sole, gold serial number
Koio $200-$300 Italy 40% recycled sole, wide sizes available
Oliver Cabell $180-$250 Italy Transparent pricing, multiple fits

Arigato shoes distinguish themselves through their weekly drop system and cultural collaborations, creating a more dynamic brand experience than traditional luxury competitors. While Common Projects maintains the status symbol appeal with their iconic gold numbering system, arigato shoes offer similar construction quality at a more accessible price point. The brand's commitment to sustainability also exceeds many competitors, incorporating recycled materials without compromising premium feel—a consideration increasingly important for conscious consumers exploring eco-friendly footwear options.

Design-wise, arigato shoes strike a balance between the ultra-minimal aesthetic of Common Projects and the more statement-oriented approach of brands like Golden Goose. The Clean 90's slightly fuller silhouette appeals to those who want minimalism without the extremely narrow profile of Italian luxury sneakers. This positioning makes arigato shoes particularly versatile for casual wear, while still maintaining enough refinement for smart-casual occasions. The availability of half sizes also gives Axel Arigato an edge over brands like Common Projects, which only offer whole sizes, making proper fit more achievable for those with specific sizing needs.

Why Choose Arigato Shoes Over Competitors:

  • • Better value proposition than Common Projects
  • • More sustainable than most luxury alternatives
  • • Weekly drops keep style fresh and current
  • • Half sizes available for better fit
  • • Strong cultural brand identity and collaborations

Conclusion: Are Arigato Shoes Worth the Investment?

After extensive testing and research, arigato shoes represent an excellent investment for those seeking premium minimalist sneakers with strong sustainability credentials. The combination of Swedish design philosophy, Portuguese craftsmanship, and Japanese cultural influences creates a unique product that stands out in the crowded luxury sneaker market. At $285-$320, they offer superior value compared to Common Projects while maintaining comparable quality and exceeding sustainability standards of most competitors.

The versatility of arigato shoes makes them particularly compelling for modern lifestyles that blend work, leisure, and travel. Whether you're exploring urban environments, taking weekend trips to national parks, or simply need elevated casual footwear that transitions from day to evening, the Clean 90 and other Axel Arigato models deliver consistent performance and style. The brand's commitment to innovation through weekly drops ensures your footwear stays current with fashion trends while the classic silhouettes remain timeless. For those interested in expanding their footwear collection, consider exploring complementary styles like sporty alternatives or statement footwear options.

Final Verdict:

Recommended For:

  • • Style-conscious professionals
  • • Sustainable fashion enthusiasts
  • • Those seeking Common Projects alternatives
  • • Urban explorers and light outdoor enthusiasts
  • • Anyone wanting versatile premium sneakers

Consider Alternatives If:

  • • Budget is under $200
  • • You need wide width options
  • • Prefer ultra-minimalist designs
  • • Require extensive arch support
  • • Need specialized athletic performance

The future looks bright for arigato shoes as Axel Arigato continues expanding globally while maintaining their core values of quality, sustainability, and cultural relevance. Their direct-to-consumer model ensures better pricing than traditional luxury brands, while their commitment to weekly drops and collaborations keeps the brand dynamic and engaging. For anyone considering an investment in premium sneakers, arigato shoes deliver on quality, style, and values—making them a wise choice for the conscious consumer who refuses to compromise on any of these aspects. Whether paired with casual everyday wear or integrated into more refined outfits, these sneakers consistently deliver the versatile performance that modern life demands.

Shop Axel Arigato Clean 90

Amazon affiliate links help support our content creation while providing you with the same great prices.

Frequently Asked Questions About Arigato Shoes

Are Axel Arigato shoes true to size?

Axel Arigato shoes generally run true to size, but sizing can vary slightly between models. The Clean 90 fits true to size with a snug initial feel that loosens as the leather breaks in. For the Marathon Runner and chunkier models, many users recommend sizing up half a size. If you're between sizes, it's typically safer to go up rather than down, especially if you plan to wear thicker socks or prefer a roomier fit. The brand offers some half sizes in US sizing, which can help achieve the perfect fit. Keep in mind that no wide sizes are available, so those with wider feet should definitely consider sizing up.

How do Arigato shoes compare to Common Projects in quality?

Arigato shoes offer comparable quality to Common Projects at a more accessible price point. Both brands use premium Italian leather and skilled European craftsmanship, with Axel Arigato manufactured in Portugal and Common Projects in Italy. The main differences lie in design philosophy and price: Common Projects focuses on ultra-minimalist aesthetics with their signature gold numbering, while Axel Arigato offers more variety with weekly drops and cultural collaborations. In terms of materials and construction, both use high-grade leather and similar sole construction methods. However, Axel Arigato edges out Common Projects in sustainability with LWG-certified leather and recycled sole materials, while maintaining superior value at $100-200 less per pair.

What makes Axel Arigato shoes sustainable?

Axel Arigato demonstrates strong sustainability commitment through multiple initiatives. All leather used is LWG (Leather Working Group) certified, ensuring environmentally responsible tanning processes. The outsoles contain at least 20% recycled rubber sourced from the SEAQUAL INITIATIVE, which transforms marine plastic waste into functional materials. The lining incorporates 29% recycled polyester from used plastic bottles. Manufacturing occurs at small, family-owned factories in Porto, Portugal, supporting traditional craftsmanship while minimizing industrial environmental impact. The brand's direct-to-consumer model also reduces packaging waste and transportation emissions compared to traditional retail distribution. Additionally, the weekly drop system helps reduce overproduction by allowing real-time response to demand rather than seasonal bulk manufacturing.

How should I care for my Axel Arigato leather sneakers?

Proper care extends the life and appearance of your Arigato shoes significantly. For leather versions, use a damp cloth to remove surface dirt, followed by a quality leather conditioner every few months to maintain suppleness. Avoid soaking the shoes or using harsh chemicals. For suede models, invest in a suede brush and protective spray to prevent staining and maintain the nap texture. Always allow shoes to air dry naturally away from direct heat sources. Use shoe trees when storing to maintain shape and prevent creasing. The brand offers a specialized care kit with water-based cleaning solution, microfiber cloth, and double-sided brush designed specifically for their materials. Regular rotation between multiple pairs also helps extend longevity by allowing leather to rest and naturally moisture balance between wears.

Are Axel Arigato shoes good for walking long distances?

Axel Arigato shoes can handle moderate walking distances comfortably, but they're primarily designed as lifestyle sneakers rather than athletic footwear. The Clean 90 features a cushioned footbed with arch support and flexible rubber sole that works well for city walking and light outdoor activities. Users report comfort for 6-8 hours of regular wear and walking distances up to 10 miles, though individual comfort varies. The leather construction provides good durability, and the cup sole offers better support than purely fashion sneakers. However, for extensive hiking or athletic activities, dedicated performance footwear would be more appropriate. The slightly stiffer initial feel improves significantly after break-in, and the minimal design provides good ground feel for natural walking mechanics.

Where can I buy authentic Axel Arigato shoes?

Authentic Axel Arigato shoes are available through several reliable channels. The brand's official website offers the complete current collection with worldwide shipping and the best selection of sizes and colors. Authorized retailers include Nordstrom, SSENSE, END Clothing, Farfetch, and Mr Porter, all offering genuine products with return policies. Physical Axel Arigato stores operate in major European cities including London, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Paris, providing in-person fitting and the full brand experience. When purchasing from third-party sellers, verify authenticity through official retailer lists on the Axel Arigato website. Avoid significantly discounted prices from unknown sellers, as counterfeits exist. Amazon also carries some models, but ensure the seller is authorized and check return policies carefully. The official website typically offers the best deals during seasonal sales and exclusive access to limited releases through their weekly drop system.

Discover more premium footwear guides at Explore National Parks Store
